context.introduction: Discover the essential ingredients and fermentation techniques that define Korean cuisine. Learn about kimchi, gochujang, and the importance of color and balance.

sections.title: Kimchi: Fermented Treasure
sections.content: Kimchi is Korea's most famous fermented food, made from napa cabbage, radish, and a blend of seasonings.

sections.title: Gochujang: Spicy Paste
sections.content: Gochujang is a spicy, fermented red chili paste that adds heat and depth to many Korean dishes.

sections.title: Essential Vegetables
sections.content: Vegetables like napa cabbage, radish, and green onion are the foundation of many Korean side dishes.

sections.title: Fermentation Tips
listItems: Good fermentation takes patience and time
Traditional ingredients create the best flavors
Proper timing develops the right taste and texture
